announcements.title: Fast-track Submission Opens Jan 13, 2026
content: TIME 2026 will open a fast-track submission window starting January 13, 2026. This is intended to attract high-quality work that benefits from workshop discussion.
We welcome submissions of strong papers that were not accepted to the WWW 2026 main conference (and similar venues), but are excellent fits for TIME.
Topics are not limited to the examples in the Call for Papers—submissions aligned with the broader TIME mission are encouraged.

announcements.title: Call for Papers Now Open
content: The call for papers for TIME 2026 is now open. We invite researchers and practitioners to submit original, unpublished research papers addressing contemporary challenges in web technologies, responsible AI, and evaluation methodologies.

announcements.title: Workshop Confirmed at WWW 2026
content: TIME 2026 has been officially confirmed as a workshop at The Web Conference 2026 in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. The workshop will be held on April 13-14, 2026.
This marks the second edition of the TIME workshop, building on the successful foundation established at WWW 2025 in Sydney.

announcements.title: TIME 2025 Workshop Archive
content: The first TIME workshop was held in Sydney during The Web Conference 2025. Access materials from the previous edition at the TIME 2025 archive.
The workshop featured presentations on cutting-edge research in multi-faceted evaluation, trustworthy AI, and cross-domain methodologies.

announcements.title: Workshop Coordinators Designation
content: We are excited to announce the designation of the workshop coordinators for TIME 2026. The coordinators will oversee the organization and execution of the workshop, ensuring a smooth and engaging experience for all participants.

announcements.title: Program Committee Assembled
content: We are pleased to announce that our distinguished Program Committee has been assembled, bringing together experts from leading institutions worldwide to ensure high-quality peer reviews for all submissions.
